data.description:
This tsl creates Hilti Stexon couple (HCW/HCWL with HSW) connection between 2 beams
One beam will receive the "HCW" or "HCWL" connector
the other beam will receive the hanger bolt "HSW"
The two beams can be parallel or crossing each other
The TSL will calculate the common area between the two beams
When the beams are parallel the TSL will support a distribution of the instances
When the beams cross each other the TSL will insert a single instance at the intersection point of the beams
If the beams are horizontal on top of each other the top beam will receive the HCW/L connector and 
the bottom beam wil receive the HSW hanger bolt
The connectors can be flipped
A distribution TSL can also be dissolved and it will generate a single TSL instance for each connector

usageEnvironment.detectionEvidence: Script explicitly collects entities from _kModelSpace. It operates on GenBeam objects (bm0, bm) to create 3D connections (Hilti Stexon), performs drilling/milling operations on Bodies, and attaches HardWrComp. No ShopDrawing prefixes (sd_), Multipage logic, or Viewport handling found.

opmProperties.description: |Defines the Distance Between the parts. -integer indicates nr of parts|
|Shows the calculated distance between the articles|
Wert > Durchmesser = Sackloch, Wert <= Durchmesser = Ständerbohrung

contextMenu.action: Swaps the roles of the two connected beams.
Dissolves a distributed TSL into single instances for each connector.
Exports selected Stexon instances to a DXX file.
Saves the current beam body geometry to the map.

scriptPurpose.summary: Automates the calculation, placement, and machining for Hilti Stexon connectors (HCW/HCWL wood couplers and HSW hanger bolts) connecting two structural timber beams.
scriptPurpose.typicalUseCase: Used when connecting two timber beams (parallel or crossing) using the Hilti Stexon system, requiring precise drilling for the connectors and accurate BOM data generation.

parameters.name: sModeDistribution
parameters.businessMeaning: Determines how multiple connectors are spaced along parallel beams. 'Even' maintains a constant max spacing, while 'Fixed' places them at specific intervals.
parameters.affectsOutput: Alters the calculation logic for 'Real Distance between' and 'Nr.' connectors generated along the beam overlap.

parameters.name: dDistanceBottom
parameters.businessMeaning: The distance from the start of the overlapping beam segment to the center of the first connector.
parameters.affectsOutput: Shifts the starting position of the connector distribution pattern along the beam.

parameters.name: dDistanceTop
parameters.businessMeaning: The distance from the end of the overlapping beam segment to the center of the last connector.
parameters.affectsOutput: Shifts the ending position of the connector distribution pattern along the beam.

parameters.name: dDistanceBetween
parameters.businessMeaning: Maximum allowed spacing between connectors (if positive) or the exact number of connectors required (if negative).
parameters.validRange: -50 to 2000 (negative for count, positive for spacing)
parameters.affectsOutput: Recalculates the quantity ('Nr.') and actual spacing ('Real Distance between') of the connectors.

parameters.name: dDistanceBetweenResult
parameters.businessMeaning: Read-only field displaying the calculated center-to-center distance between the connectors.

parameters.name: nNrResult
parameters.businessMeaning: Read-only field displaying the total number of connector instances generated.

parameters.name: sVersion
parameters.businessMeaning: Selects the specific Hilti connector model type (HCW, HCWL) or allows manual configuration (Custom).
parameters.affectsOutput: May presets drilling dimensions or hardware BOM data associated with the specific Hilti product.

parameters.name: dOffset
parameters.businessMeaning: Lateral shift of the connector position perpendicular to the beam axis.
parameters.affectsOutput: Moves the drill holes and connector insertion point sideways across the beam face.

parameters.name: dOffsetStart
parameters.businessMeaning: Defines a variable lateral offset at the start of the beam (tapered distribution).
parameters.affectsOutput: Modifies the lateral position of the first connector if the distribution implies a gradient.

parameters.name: dOffsetEnd
parameters.businessMeaning: Defines a variable lateral offset at the end of the beam (tapered distribution).
parameters.affectsOutput: Modifies the lateral position of the last connector if the distribution implies a gradient.

parameters.name: dRotation
parameters.businessMeaning: Rotational angle of the connector/drill pattern around the insertion axis.
parameters.affectsOutput: Rotates the drill holes and potentially the connector orientation within the beam cross-section.

parameters.name: dDiameter
parameters.businessMeaning: Diameter of the primary vertical drilling required for the connector.
parameters.affectsOutput: Size of the cylindrical hole drilled into the timber.

parameters.name: dDepth
parameters.affectsOutput: Length of the cylindrical hole drilled into the timber.

parameters.name: dDiameterSink
parameters.businessMeaning: Diameter of a secondary counterbore. If > Main Diameter, it creates a pocket; if <= Main Diameter, it creates a through-hole section.
parameters.affectsOutput: Creates a larger diameter pocket at the top of the hole or adjusts the top section of the drill.

parameters.name: dDepthSink
parameters.affectsOutput: Determines how deep the secondary pocket or through-section extends.

parameters.name: dWidthMill
parameters.businessMeaning: Width of a rectangular milling (slot) cut.
parameters.affectsOutput: Creates a rectangular slot on the beam surface.

parameters.name: dDepthMill
parameters.businessMeaning: Depth of the rectangular milling cut.
parameters.affectsOutput: Determines the penetration depth of the rectangular slot.

parameterDependencies.effect: Recalculates 'Real Distance between' and 'Nr.' based on 'Max. Distance between / Quantity'.
Uses 'Max. Distance between / Quantity' as a fixed step size.
Interprets the value as the exact number of connectors rather than a spacing.
Potentially updates internal drilling parameters (Diameter/Depth) to match manufacturer specs for that specific part.

outputEntities.description: Vertical holes for the Hilti connector, potentially with a counterbore (Sackloch) or specific top section.
Rectangular slots if Width/Depth Mill are > 0.
BOM entries for Hilti Wood coupler (HCW/HCWL) and Hanger bolt (HSW), linked to the element group.
Exports geometry and tooling info to a .dxx file for Hilti software.

data.markdown:
# Hilti-Einzeln.mcr

## Overview
Automates the connection of two timber beams using Hilti Stexon hardware (HCW/HCWL wood couplers and HSW hanger bolts). It calculates drilling, milling, and hardware placement for both parallel (distributed) and crossing (single) beam configurations.

## Usage Environment
| Space | Supported | Notes |
|-------|-----------|-------|
| Model Space | Yes | Required for 3D beam selection and machining. |
| Paper Space | No | Not supported. |
| Shop Drawing | No | Not supported. |

## Prerequisites
- **Required Entities**: Two `GenBeam` elements.
- **Minimum Beam Count**: 2.
- **Required Settings**: None.

## Usage Steps

### Step 1: Launch Script
Command: `TSLINSERT` → Select `Hilti-Einzeln.mcr` from the catalog.

### Step 2: Select First Beam
```
Command Line: Select beam 1:
Action: Click on the first timber beam in the 3D model.
```

### Step 3: Select Second Beam
```
Command Line: Select beam 2:
Action: Click on the second timber beam (either crossing or parallel to the first).
```

### Step 4: Configure Connection
Once inserted, the script automatically detects if beams are crossing (places one connector) or parallel (distributes connectors). Use the **Properties Palette** to adjust spacing, offsets, and drill sizes as needed.

## Properties Panel Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| **Distribution** | | | |
| Mode of Distribution | dropdown | Even | Defines if spacing is calculated evenly ('Even') or fixed at a specific step ('Fixed'). |
| Start Distance | number | 0 | Distance from the start of the overlap to the first connector. |
| End Distance | number | 0 | Distance from the end of the overlap to the last connector. |
| Max. Distance between / Quantity | number | 500 | Positive value = Max spacing (mm). Negative value = Exact number of connectors. |
| Real Distance between | number | 0 | (Read-Only) Calculated center-to-center distance. |
| Nr. | number | 0 | (Read-Only) Total quantity of connectors generated. |
| **Version** | | | |
| Version | dropdown | Custom | Selects Hilti product type (HCW, HCWL) or Custom settings. |
| **Position** | | | |
| Offset | number | 0 | Lateral shift of the connector perpendicular to the beam axis. |
| Offset Start | number | 0 | Lateral offset at the start of the beam (for tapered distribution). |
| Offset End | number | 0 | Lateral offset at the end of the beam (for tapered distribution). |
| Rotation | number | 0 | Rotational angle of the connector/drill pattern (degrees). |
| **Drill** | | | |
| Diameter | number | 30 | Diameter of the primary vertical drill hole. |
| Depth | number | 250 | Depth of the primary drill hole. |
| **2. Bohrung (Counterbore)** | | | |
| Diameter | number | 0 | Diameter of the counterbore. If > Main Diameter, it creates a pocket; otherwise, it adjusts the top section. |
| Depth | number | 0 | Depth of the counterbore. |
| **Milling** | | | |
| Width | number | 0 | Width of the rectangular milling slot. |
| Depth | number | 0 | Depth of the rectangular milling slot. |

## Right-Click Menu Options

| Menu Item | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| Swap Beams | Swaps the roles of the two connected beams (e.g., top becomes bottom). |
| Generate Single Instances | Dissolves a distributed connection into individual TSL instances for each connector. |
| Stexon Export | Exports selected connector data to a `.dxx` file for Hilti software. |
| save Beam Body | Saves the current beam body geometry to the map. |

## Settings Files
None required.

## Tips
- **Setting Quantity**: To specify an exact number of connectors for parallel beams, enter a **negative number** in the "Max. Distance between / Quantity" property (e.g., enter `-5` for 5 connectors).
- **Orientation**: If the hardware is applied to the wrong beam (e.g., the bolt is on the top instead of the bottom), use the **Swap Beams** right-click option.
- **Crossing Beams**: When beams cross, the script places a single instance at the intersection point regardless of the distribution settings.
- **Rotation**: Use the **Rotation** property if the connector orientation needs to be aligned differently relative to the beam surface.

## FAQ
- Q: How do I distribute connectors evenly along the entire overlap?
- A: Set "Mode of Distribution" to `Even`, ensure "Start Distance" and "End Distance" are `0`, and set "Max. Distance between" to your desired maximum spacing.

- Q: My beams are crossing, but I don't see any connectors.
- A: Ensure you have selected two distinct beams. If they cross at a very sharp angle or barely touch, check that the intersection calculation is finding a valid common area.

- Q: What is the difference between "Even" and "Fixed" distribution?
- A: `Even` calculates the spacing required to fit the maximum number of connectors within the limit. `Fixed` places connectors at exact intervals (step size) defined by the "Max. Distance between" value, potentially leaving a gap at the end.
